DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the study is to assess the safety and tolerability of AZD2066 and to explore the effect of a single dose of AZD2066 on the function of the cardia (the opening between the stomach and the esophagus) compared to placebo (not containing any medical substance) in healthy volunteers.
DOC.brief_title: 14473 - D9126C00001 Proof of Principle Study - Effect of AZD2066 on Transient Lower Esophageal Sphincter Relaxations
DOC.criteria: Provision of written consent prior to any study specific procedures. Healthy subjects, age 1845 years inclusive. Females must be of no childbearing potential or must use a highly effective contraceptive method. Clinically normal physical findings and laboratory values at the time of preentry visit, as judged by the investigator. Clinically significant illness within the 2 weeks prior to the first dose of the investigational product, including a suspected/manifested infection according to WHO risk categories 2, 3 or 4, as judged by the investigator. A measured LES pressure of < 5mm Hg. History of previous or ongoing psychiatric disease/condition.
